summary: This document is an email chain from June 13-14, 2019, discussing a draft indictment against Jeffrey Epstein. The correspondence involves prosecutors from the Southern District of New York debating the level of detail to include, balancing the need to protect victim identities and preserve investigative details with the desire to convey the case's seriousness to the public and provide material for a press conference.

persons.name: Geoff
persons.context: Mentioned as needing more material to work with for a press conference about the Epstein indictment.

events.title: Draft Indictment Circulated
events.description: A draft indictment against Jeffrey Epstein is circulated among prosecutors for review. The draft is described as keeping facts sparse to protect victims and preserve confidential details for vetting future witnesses.

events.title: Internal Debate on Indictment Details
events.description: Prosecutors engage in an internal email debate about the draft indictment, discussing the balance between protecting victim anonymity and instilling public confidence in the seriousness of the case.

locations: One Saint Andrew's Plaza, New York, NY 10007
keyFacts: Prosecutors in the Southern District of New York were actively drafting an indictment against Jeffrey Epstein in June 2019.
A key concern was protecting the identities of victims and keeping specific details confidential to help corroborate future witnesses.
There was an internal debate about whether the indictment was too sparse, with some prosecutors wanting to add more detail to convey the case's seriousness and aid a public press conference.
The correspondence shows the operational and ethical considerations involved in high-profile sex crime prosecutions.
